shortcontents.shortcontent: The Ms. contains the following texts: I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 3r-15vb) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 16ra-48va) III) Anaphoras (fols. 48vb-133rb) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 48vb-60ra) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ preceded by the excerpt from the “Book of the Testament” (fol. 60vb-vb) (cp. MQ, IV, Qǝddase ʾǝgziʾ, §§1-17) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 64ra-73vb) III-4) Anaphora of St. John, son of Thunder (fols. 74ra-81rb) III-5) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 81rb-87va) III-6) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 87va-96ra) III-7) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy of St Gregory”) (fols. 96ra-101va) III-8) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 101va-108va) III-9) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 108va-113va) III-10) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 113va-119rb) III-11) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 119rb-123vb) III-12) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 124ra-125va) III-13) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 125vb-130vb) III-14) Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 130vb-133rb).

owners.owner: According to crude recent notes pencil, in fol. 2rv (s. Varia), the Ms. was one time owned by Däbrä Libanos ʾAnbäsät (the old church of ʾAmbäsät).

dcomments.dcomment: Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913) is mentioned as the reigning monarch in fols. 8rab, 15rab.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn. Many leaves are heavily stained with dirt, some leaves (e.g., fol. 65) are rumpled.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (partly missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the leather cover (at least 3 tools are used: double line fillet, criss-cross, x-form).

bnothers.bnother: Traces of endband stitches (rows of slamm holes visible on the spine folds of the quires).

squires.squire: A(fols. 1r-2v) – I(10/fols. 3r-12v) – II(10; s. l.: 5, stub after 6; 6, stub after 5/fols. 13r-22v) – III(10; s. l.: 5, stub after 5; 6, stub after 4/fols. 23r-32v) – IV(9; s. l.: 4, stub after 6/fols. 33r-41v) – V(8/fols. 42r-49v) – VI(10/fols. 50v-59r) – VII(13; s. l.: 12, stub after 1/fols. 60r-72v) – VIII(10/fols. 73v-82r) – IX(10/fols. 83v-92r) – X(10/fols. 93v-102r) – XI(8/fols. 103v-110r) – XII(10/fols. 111v-120r) – XIII(10/fols. 121v-130r) – XIV(4/fols. 131v-134r)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 20r). Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 60r). Structural pricks are partly visible (s. fols. 79v-80r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 20r). Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 60r). Structural pricks are partly visible (s. fols. 79v-80r). The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; first words (headings or parts of headings) of constituent texts; directives for the ministers; name of the ruling king; some of the musical notation signs above the lines; abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.
The beginning parts of some of the texts are written alternately in red and black lines (e. g., fols. 3r, 96ra, 101rab, 108va).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይካ or ካ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ or ዲ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ይሕ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ እማ፡ for እማሬ፡ እግ፡ ተሠ፡ for እግዚአብሔር፡ ተሣሀለነ፡ (e. g., fol. 14ra) ቅ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ እግ፡ ጸ፡ ፍ፡ ም፡ ሰማ፡ ወም፡ ቅድ፡ ስብ፡ (and similar) for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጸባኦት፡ ፍጹም፡ ምሉእ፡ ሰማያት፡ ወምድር፡ ቅድሳተ፡ ስብሐቲከ፡ (e. g., fol. 126rb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: The hymn Śärawitä mälaʾǝktihu lä-mädḫane ʿaläm... “The hosts of the angels of the Saviour of the World...” is written in compressed script (e.g., fols. 80ra, 95rb). Bookmark is inserted in the left upper corner of fol. 55r, for navigation in the text.

extras.extra: - Fols. 1v, 18v: Crude notes (writing exercises?). - Fol. 2rv: Crude recent notes in pencil, apparently indicating ownership of the Ms. - Fol. 2rv: Doodles. - Fols. 16r, 19r, 22v, 25r, 28v: Crude notes in the upper margin, some of them referring to texts beginning on respective pages. - Fols. 123v, 130r: Notes in the upper margin, written alternately in black and red letters, of similar content. - Fol. 124r: Note in the upper margin, in green ink, enclosed in a frame, poorly legible. - Fol. 133v: Crude note in violet ink.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes in the upper margin, in part rubricated and enclosed in frames, referring to liturgical occasions on which respective Anaphoras are celebrated: fols. 81r, 96r, 108v, 113v, 119v.

drawing.details: Two crude, recent drawings in pencil
Crude drawings of objects, including priestly crosses.

frames.frame: - Fol. 3r (incipit page of Text I): wide coloured (red, gray, black) ornamental band, with interlaces and floral ornamentation motifs. - Fol. 64r (incipit page of Text III-3): coloured (red, black) frontispiece ornamental frame in the form of a cross, with geometric ornamentation motifs.
